description:
The action-packed new ongoing series by Gunsmith Cats creator Kenichi Sonoda is here at last, with a bargain price and super-sized 48-page kickoff issue!

It's a typical school day for Hoichi. He's skipping class and beating the stuffing out of a bunch of upperclassmen, which makes him about the only person on the whole planet who isn't glued to the television -- today's the ribbon-cutting ceremony for the Space Elevator, a gigantic earth-to-orbit elevator built by those lovable aliens, the Riofaldians, who arrived on Earth ten years ago. Today, the mass media is proud to report, tens of thousands of Riofaldians are working side by side with humanity, as good neighbors on the march to global prosperity. Hoichi's ultra-rich, ultra-brilliant, and ultra-eccentric grandfather (the author of a loony book claiming the Riofalds are out to take over the Earth) doesn't agree and this has driven a wedge between him and his equally eccentric grandson. But that -- and the history of mankind -- is about to change forever! Don't dare miss the series that's redefining the giant-robot story for the 21st century -- Cannon God EXAXXION!

For both new manga readers and longtime fans of series like Robotech or Gundam Wing!

Nanotechnological battlesuits that make the wearer superhuman, alien invasions, city-smashing giant robots, insanely powerful handguns, cover-to-cover action, and lots of sexy women -- alien, human, and android! -- make this signature Sonoda with a futuristic punch!

Dark Horse celebrates Shi's 10th Anniversary with a new Tucci series! Ana Ishikawa returns to her native Japan where she desperately tries to avert an all out war between the secretive sects of the Kyoto and Nara Sohei. And with the Narans of the verge of annihilation, the Kyoto Sohei are about to rub it in?with the encouragement of the Yakuza and with potentially disastrous consequences. Once again, Ana in the guise of Death Incarnate, will take up the naginata and don her grandfather's Kabuki face paint in order to save both cities, even if it means turning to her father's murderer Masahiro Arashi to do so.
name: Ju-Nen

description: The Kabuki stage is set for ambush as Ana comes face to face with the mysterious Lady Kaoyo. One of the original "Nara Six" who hunted Shi in the acclaimed Way of the Warrior story-arc the beautiful Kaoyo readies her Nara warriors to annihilate the unsuspecting Imperial Kyoto Kabuki Theatre Troup. What follows is a showdown between the two, a duel of elegance, beauty, and the flash of the naginata as not only is Kaoyo far superior in skill, but desire for blood as well. For Kaoyo is also obsessed with the death of her brother, Nichi, and its catalyst, Ana Ishikawa ... Shi.

As Ana's grandfather Yoshitora's life hangs by a thread, Ana realizes she must do battle against her greatest foe and best friend Tomoe. Surrounded by the venomous fan dancer, Lady Kaoyo and the desperate Nara Sohei, Ana has but one choice for survival. She must retreat into the darkened depths of her own vengeful past to bring forward the most primal forces of execution and truly embrace the Spirit of Death ... Shi.

Ana, in the guise of Shi, must take the stage as the Kyoto Sohei's vengeance-themed Kabuki is literally brought to life before a terrified audience held hostage. Steel will smash against steel as Ana attempts to save the trapped Sohei and parishioners against the maddened Lady Kaoyo and her 100 warriors.

Shi: The Illustrated Warrior #1 is the vanguard edition of seven monthly issues by Shi creator Billy Tucci and New York Times best-selling author Craig Shaw Gardner (Batman). Combining the very best aspects of Craig's novelized prose and Billy's dynamic and richly detailed illustrations, The Illustrated Warrior is based on the legendary Way of the Warrior story arc, but with an added twist that forever alters the Shi universe we've all come to know. Focusing on Ana's tortured past, first battles and her quest for vengeance, this series goes to great lengths to bring about the most thorough and thought-provoking Shi series ever!
name: The Illustrated Warrior

description: This issue places us alongside Ana Ishikawa as she dons the Sohei battle garb of her ancestors for the first time to avenge the brutal beating of her grandfather, also focusing on Ana's torment as she witnesses the wives and children mourn those she has slain in battle. Ana vows to forego her quest, but now it is the charismatic Yakuza boss Masahiro Arashi who is obsessed with vengeance, recruiting the dark and ruthless warrior monks, the Nara Sohei! The Nara embark on a pilgrimage of blood as they search for a "demon of death" and turn the streets of New York City into an arena of death!

Ana Ishikawa abandons her quest for vengeance and attempts to leave her tortured and murderous past behind. She begins a budding romance with police detective Peter DeNyse and is overjoyed by the unexpected arrival of her best friend, the vivacious and beautiful Tomoe Gozan. But, storm clouds have gathered overhead as Arashi, thirsting for revenge, brings in the most notorious off all assassins - the black-cloaked Nara Sohei. These ruthless warriors have dedicated their lives to the destruction of their centuries-old enemy, the Kyoto Sohei. And Ana has carelessly left behind several clues, all leading to her Kyoto lineage, and the Nara are sent to hunt down the Shi killer. This can only mean one thing: Ana Ishikawa, once the hunter, is now the hunted!

Trying to find some semblance of a normal life and leaving her bloody battles behind, Ana Ishikawa spends an evening reminiscing with her best friend, the vivacious and beautiful Tomoe Gozan. The reunion will be bittersweet however, as unknown to both, Tomoe leads a band of assassins hired to deliver the head of "Shi" to Yakuza crime lord, Masahiro Arashi. While the two share a wonderful evening of wine, Tomoe's Nara warriors wreak havoc across New York City. The Nara are ruthless warriors that have dedicated their lives to the destruction of their centuries-old enemies from Kyoto. Bent on vengeance, these black-cloaked Sohei murder innocents at every corner in an attempt to draw out the Kyoto Sohei known as Shi. Finally Ana once again takes up the naginata, dons her grandfather's kabuki make-up, and attempts to stop these new warriors of death, running into the colossus of Nara itself! A colossus called "Gojira."

The hunter has become the hunted. Yoshitora arrives from Kyoto just in time to save Ana from the Nara behemoth, Gojira. The master Sohei then passes on to Ana the ancient Sohei armor her mother had forsaken, as she attempts to halt the Nara assassins hired to deliver the head of "Shi" to Yakuza crime lord, Masahiro Arashi. Lead by the lethally beautiful Tomoe, the Nara cut a murderous swath through New York as they search for their quarry. And unbeknownst to both Ana and Tomoe, the two friends are on a collision coarse that could destroy their lives!

The time of Battle is upon us. Ana Ishikawa dons the ancient Kyoto armor her mother had forsaken as she attempts to halt the Nara Sohei once and for all. One by one the Nara assassins are sought out and destroyed, and Shi will finally purge New York of such bloodshed. She will duel against the leader of the black-cloaked warriors atop the Queensborough/59th Street Bridge. But Ana's best friend, the lethally beautiful Tomoe, leads the Nara. Tomoe's mantra is that of the butterfly, and she wields her bladed war-fans in a delicate-but-deadly sweep of a song. Bound by honor, a broken-hearted Tomoe must deliver the head of Shi to the ruthless Yakuza crime lord, Masahiro Arashi. Stinging rain and striking lighting slash as embattled friends clash 400 feet above the East River in an incredible dance of death. There will be only one victor, but two lives will be destroyed.

Before Ana can complete her mission of vengeance against the murderous Yakuza Lord Arashi, she must fight by his side against his rebellious samurai. Don't miss this stunning conclusion to the most dramatic and beautifully illustrated Shi series ever.

Ren and his crew continue on their quest in search of the the second treasure of rule.  They are once again stopped by Bloth and end up in the kingdom of the Pale Warriors. After some confusion, the Pale warriors assist Ren and lead them on their way.
name: In the Caverns of Chaos

description: Variant: No price on cover (pic 1)
name: Welcome to Videoland/ The Fruit and Vegetiable War/ Every Dog Has His Day/ Money Changes Everything

volume.name: Some Trouble of a SeRRious Nature

description: New York City Trade Center commemoration.
name: Through the Ashes

description: Zoom Suit is the The Greatest American Hero meets Cinderella. Twelve year-old Myles Mason is bummed about not being able to afford a Halloween costume. But from the sky falls an alien armor that crashes to earth just a few feet behind him. Hilarity and superhero antics ensue in Zoom Suit, a classical "ugly duckling" story set in a superhero universe. Covers by Patton, Billy Tucci, and Bob Layton.
Tony Stark throws down with Titanium Man!
name: Old Soldiers

description: The world has turned upside down! The Skrulls have taken the Earth as part of their empire, the Avengers and Initiative are scattered...but there are two people who want some answers. One has a hammer and one has a shield.

A very special FINAL CRISIS one-shot honoring the passing of a great hero who's been a staple in the DC Universe for years. All that remains is one final memory that the League experiences together as they must fulfill his last wishes or die trying.
name: Caretakers of Mars

description: Martians come to Earth to kill and conquer. And the Dragon...is he one of them?
name: Savage Dragon: Martian Spy

description: The Dragon and his new friend, a learned fighter, attempt to survive and escape a Martian headquarters.
name: Killer Monday

description: Can the Dragon escape with the aid of a semi-friendly Martian scientist? Maybe if he gives up his eyes...
The Dragon puts the smack-down on the Martian invasion force.
name: Hard Rain

description: Caught with blood on his hands, Steel is arrested for a series of brutal murders. John Henry Irons risks everything to expose the real killer's identity and bring him to justice before he can strike again.
name: Blood Guilt

description:
Her name is      . She's Spider-Man's newest and most terrifying nemesis -- and she just discovered his secret identity. With an army of villains at her command, even with the help of Daredevil, can Spidey protect his secret identity from his new foe? Find out as Marc Guggenheim and Phil Jimenez give you the fight of Spidey’s life against the Brand New !

Spoilers

We start of in a dark sewer where Spider-Man is confused and was hung upside down by a woman and she stated that she's the girl who is going to kill Spider-Man. We they go two weeks earlier where Spider-Man and Daredevil are working together to defeat Fracture. Spider-Man uses his webs to hold Fracture in place, then he kicks him in the face and webs his eyes up so that he couldn't see what was happening but Fracture breaks out of the webbing but as soon as he does that, he is kicked in the face once more but by Daredevil. We learn that Fracture was trying to demolish a construction site to collect on the insurance and we also learn that someone was using night-vision watching over Spider-Man. Fracture then breaks the construction site into little dried up pieces and the whole construction site falls. Spider-Man uses his webs to stop the pieces falling and while he was doing that, Daredevil throws his club at Fracture causing him to fall unconcious into a pit of cement. It was revealed  that the person watching over them was a woman and she followed Spider-Man into his apartment but then she returned to her home and planned what she will do to Peter Parker/ Spider-Man.

We then go one week later early in the morning and Peter Parker is in a comic book store sorting out comics. The other worker there, Mike, asks him if he reads any comics but then Peter said that comics remind him of work, Mike then tells Peter to read some X-Men but Peter said that he was not a X-Men fan because he doesn't get along with a lot of them. Peter Parker's spider-sense then started tingling and he dived and told Mike to get down as a bullet shoots right through the shop and comics. We then see who the sniper was and it was the same woman who was watching and following Peter Parker, she started shooting arrows from her crossbow and Peter carried Mike and jumped out of the shop from the window. The sniper still doesn't give up so Peter and Mike take cover in the subway station. Mike asks why Peter was being shot at, Peter says that he has a secret and tells Mike that he's not who Mike thought he was and Peter said that he was a skrull. Mike was scared and he ran off. We then go one week later in the Fifth Precinct and we learn that Vin was framed for shooting a drug dealer but until the real murderer was found, Vin will be on a suspension.

A man then goes to Peter Parker's apartment and Peter Parker then learns that someone was suing Spider-Man. We then go back to Vin and he gets ran over by a car and his head was bleeding after that, one of the pedestrian then asks if Vin was okay and Vin said that he was okay. The next day, Vin was in a bar playing pool with Harry Osborn as Peter Parker walked in, Vin told Peter that he has been having a lot of bad luck lately from being framed to being a victim of identity theft. Vin returns home and he was attacked by the woman and she told him to wear the Spider-Man costume believing that Vin was Peter Parker. We now go back to present time and the woman releases the chain that is holding "Spider-Man" upside down and then she unmasks "Spider-Man".
name: Kraven's First Hunt Part One: To Squash A Spider!

description: Joe Hamill discovers the H-E-R-O Dial when working on the demolition of the building Tony Finch lived in, and when he uses it he becomes a female super-heroine and loses the dial. Meanwhile, Robby Reed pulls a prison escape.
name: Ch-Ch-Changes Part 1

description: A depressed teenager named Jerry working at a dead-end job narrates his first adventure after finding the H-Dial.
name: Powers and Abilities

description: Jerry Feldon continues his narration about his first foray into crime-fighting and its dismal consequence.
name: Powers and Abilites Part 2

description:
Overview

The reinvention of the Dial H for Hero concept continues! Jerry Feldon's learning that life as a super-hero isn't all it's cracked up to be! Jerry decides to share the secret of H-E-R-O with Molly, the girl he loves. But when a gunman robs their restaurant, Jerry's powers might be the only thing that can save Molly - if he doesn't screw things up and accidentally kill her instead!
name: Powers and Abilites Part 3

description: The story comes to full circle. After his fiasco in the last issue, Jerry attempts to end his life but is saved by Superman while losing the H-Dial in the process. Jerry ends up joining the crisis hot-line as a volunteer.
name: Powers and Abilites Conclusion

description: The H-E-R-O device passes into a new set of hands! Meet Matt Allen. He's got a great job, a loving wife and family, the high score on his company's bowling team...and the H-E-R-O device. There's a good chance things are never gonna be the same for Matt again!
name: Meet Matt Allen

description: Young Andrea Allen has found the H-E-R-O device! Just in time, too, because her middle school has been overrun by super-heroes, super-villains, and invaders from another dimension. Can she sort this mess out before she gets expelled?
name: Girl Power

description: A group of guys calling themselves Chaos, Inc. finds the H- E-R-O device and records their crazy, irresponsible super-powered stunts on digicam, quickly turning them into the hottest thing on the underground Internet video circuit! Meanwhile, someone who's been searching for the H-E-R- O device through the years stumbles onto Chaos Inc.'s website and finally realizes who's in possession of the treasured device.
name: Don't Try This @ Home, Episode 1

description: When we last left the guys of "Captain Chaos Productions," they were using the earth-shattering powers of the H-E-R-O device to perform dimwitted stunts and random acts of destruction. Now slick Hollywood producer Ronnie Barzell promises he can deliver fame and fortune. Does he really want to make them famous, or just get his hands on the device?
name: Don't Try This @ Home, Episode 2

description: A new storyline begins, and not everyone who gets the H-E-R-O device wants to be a hero! Gotham City native Tony Finch has another dream: to be the greatest super-villain of all time! He's made his plans. He's done his homework. And now, thanks to the device, he has the power. The question is: What's he going to do with it in a city defended by Batman and populated by a horde of other villains?
name: A World Made of Glass, Part 1

description: Lesson One in Gotham City is "don't screw with the Joker, or the punchline could be your death." Would-be supervillain Tony Finch, who now has the H-E-R-O device, learned that lesson the hard way years ago.but people don't forget a thing like that in Gotham.not for a long, long time. Now that Tony's dabbling in the super-villain game, will he wind up on top of the heap, or fitted for one of the special jackets they hand out at Arkham?
name: A World Made of Glass, Part 2

description: Joe continues to have problems adjusting to being female, as his wife Amy temporarily abandons him. Joe dreams of his wife finding the dial, but he is instead trapped in the super-heroine body of Shocking Suzi but has lost the super powers. Elsewhere, Robby Reed decides to search Heaton, PA for the H-E-R-O Dial.
name: Ch-Ch-Changes, Conclusion

description:
Metropolis archaeologists find some rather unusual ancient cave art featuring what looks to be a prehistoric super-hero. Go back thousands of years to those thrilling bygone days of early man and see what happens when the H-Dial falls into the hands of a Cro-Magnon!

Notes:

  • Ranked #43 in Wizard Magazine's list of "100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born".
name: The Great Leap Forward

concept_credits.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

first_appearance_concepts.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

description: Robby Reed tries to convince Jerry Feldon to help him combat a villain who will be using the H-E-R-O Dial, by revealing his past to Jerry, as Jerry's latent super powers kick in.
name: Whatever Happened to Robby Reed?

description: Robby Reed and Jerry Feldon track a serial killer who has the H-E-R-O dial, while avoiding the police themselves.
name: Goodguys & Badguys, Pt. 1

description:
Overview

There’s a super-powered serial killer on the loose, but former H-E-R-O device users Jerry Feldon and Robby Reed aren’t ready to face him. Robby fears what’s waiting for him in the future, and Jerry fears that Reed himself is crazy and might be the real danger. But ready or not, the killer is carving a path of death and destruction…and it’s leading right to our reluctant pair of heroes!
name: Goodguys & Badguys, Pt. 2

description: Robby Reed and Jerry Feldon finally defeat the serial killer who has the H-E-R-O dial, at the cost of Jerry's life and the loss of the dial.
name: Goodguys & Badguys, Conclusion

description:
A mysterious maniac is murdering prominent citizens of Gotham City, each time leaving a ghastly grin on the victims' faces. Batman soon tracks down the killer: the Joker!

This volume gives readers new insight into the early encounters between Batman and The Joker that led the Clown Prince of Crime down the path to insanity. Guest-starring the original Green Lantern Alan Scott, this trade paperback volume featuring two tales written by Ed Brubaker (GOTHAM CENTRAL, Captain America), winner of the 2007 Eisner Award for Best Writer.

Witness Batman's first encounter with the Joker in this volume collecting the graphic novel BATMAN: THE MAN WHO LAUGHS, by Ed Brubaker and Doug Mahnke. This collection also includes DETECTIVE COMICS #784-786, a murder mystery guest-starring Green Lantern Alan Scott.

OverviewThe heroes have suffered devasting losses, and the villain has fled with the H-device. Now he's building an army of former H-E-R-Os while Robby Reed, the original user, tries to figure out a way to fight a super-powered army — alone.
name: Pieces of Hate, Part 1

description: Robby Reed tracks down Wayne of the Captain Chaos videos, and together they unsuccessfully confront the serial killer who holds the H-E-R-O dial. The killer kidnaps Andrea Allen, kills Wayne's friends, and recruits Tony Finch to help him kill other previous users of the H-E-R-O dial.
name: Pieces of Hate, Part 2

description:
Overview:

Beware the return of…Starhawk! First it was the recovery of a certain world-famous shield…and now the enigmatic Starhawk reigns death from above! How and why is this original Guardian of the Galaxy here in our reality, and what does his ominous arrival mean for our motley crew of freedom fighters?
name: Beyond Belief

description:
In month two of TRINITY, Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman — alongside their Justice League teammates — cross paths with the mysterious Konvikt and learn more about their fated connection within the DC Universe! This month’s co-features focus on Hawkman, Gangbuster, John Stewart and the intriguing new psychic known as Tarot!

SPOILERS

Truth, Justice & The American Way

Tarot is freaking out. First she was attacked by "super-villains." Next, every time she tries doing a reading with her cards, they keep showing different trinities. And they keep changing to show Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman.

In the Justice League watchtower, Wonder Woman, Batman and Superman have a talk. Batman is tending to Diana's burn. To his surprise, the burn changed shape. Before it was "serpentine" shape and now it looks sort of like an "h." Batman comments that they both appeared mystical. Wonder Woman says that's what she wants to talk about. The wolf-creature that burned her called them a "trinity." She also mentions the reality-warp dreams they shared. They start going over the different combinations that could make them a trinity.

Tarot realizes she can't reject the cards. She tries to give in to get a full reading. She begins to see what the three are at their core. She begins to see how they are connected when the wall caves in. Jose (in his Gangbuster attire) is fighting off some big furry creatures. He tells her to run but one grabs her and runs off.

Almost

Hawkman is trying to uncover who is behind the recent attempted thefts of mystical items. He runs into Gangbuster, who insists on joining him. Gangbuster is determined to find and save Tarot.
name: Truth, Justice & the American Way;  Almost

description: The Justice Society of America is split down the middle as their allegiance to the being known as Gog has disrupted the team. Are Gog's motives on the level, or is it all some insidious plot to destroy mankind?
name: One World, Under Gog Part II: Wish Fulfillment

description:
A "Batman: R.I.P." issue — and part 1 of the 5-part story "The Return of Hush!"

Readers who were surprised by Catwoman's return last month haven't see anything yet as Hush makes a dramatic return to the life of Batman. What will this mean for Bruce Wayne? This epic story kicks off the countdown to DETECTIVE #850!
name: Heart of Hush Part 1: First Families of Gotham

description:
Meet the greatest time-traveling hero of the year 1,000,000 A.D. – PETER PLATINUM! Lost in time, Booster Gold is confronted by a hero a million times more self-involved than himself. But if Booster does find his way back to the present, Batman will be waiting for him.

Summay

Booster Gold and Skeets get flug to the year 1,000,000AD and meet Peter Platinum, a ego driven "hero". Rip Hunter, Supernova, and Rose Levin find Booster and take him back to present where the three then quit working for Rip.

Booster breaks up a robbery by the Royal Flush Gang, with the help of Green Arrow and Hal Jordon.

Batman orders Booster to the Batcave and asks him about some photos of Booster trying to save Barbara Gorgon. Booster explains what he's being doing and Batman gives him a pat on the back and thanks him for what he's done.

Booster then goes back to Rip to beg for his old job back and Rip surprises him with Goldstar, Booster sister. Rip explains how he saved her at the last minute.

Booster and Goldstar then take a time sphere to paris 1889 for lunch. Once Rip is all alone he reveals that Booster Gold is his father.

Epilogue

A shadowy figure enters a hanger where the blue beetle's ship is stored and laughs.
name: Blue & Gold, Conclusion: Holding Back the Years

description:
PRECIOUS CARGO
Serra faces an old enemy while her ship in repairs

NOT SO HAPPILY EVER AFTER
The telling of how Rikk and Hakwe first met
name: PRECIOUS CARGO/ NOT SO HAPPILY EVER AFTER

description:
Mage of Shades

A Walk in the Woods

the Legend of Oge K'tion

The Legend of Oge K'tion

What Dreams May Come...

It's finally come down to this -- literally the last Defender standing, as Kyle Richmond goes head-to-head with his past, his present AND his future...! And Yandroth is right there to exploit all three of them! And...at long last: Dr. Strange! The Hulk! Namor, the Sub-Mariner! Together again...for the first time! Plus, the Squadron Sinister! All this...and a last page that will leave you shell-shocked!
name: Old Ghosts

description:
Dr. Henry Jones Jr. may be the world's preeminent archeologist, but that doesn't mean he's spent his life in the library! Ready and able to do whatever it takes to preserve the final remnants of history's most significant happenings, he'll go head-to-head against Hitler's elite who want nothing more than to exploit objects of ancient power in pursuit of world dominance!

Be there for the beginning of this roller coaster thrill ride of non-stop excitement as Indiana Jones dons his hat, packs his whip, and undertakes an endeavor more awesome than anything ever!
name: Part 1

volume.name: Indiana Jones and the Tomb of the Gods

name: Snap Decisions

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero
